articles.title: Kane's Free High School Data Science Bootcamp
articles.contents:
Sign up for our e-mail list to receive updates as we move forward.



Kane’s Free High School Data Science Bootcamp will run from Tuesday, June 1st through Thursday, June 24th. The expected workload is 13 hours per week: 2.5 hours in class with Harvard Preceptor David Kane, lecturing live at around 8:00 PM EDT and 10.5 hours of work completed by students on their own. By the end of this bootcamp, students will be able to do basic data science! The course covers the first three weeks or so in Kane’s introductory data science class, Gov 1005: Data.
There are no prerequisites. The programming language we will be using is R. You must have a computer with R, RStudio and Git installed.
Sign up for our e-mail list to receive updates as we move forward.

articles.title: Schedule
articles.contents:
Two key resources: Preceptor’s Primer for Bayesian Data Science and its associated tutorials. Assignments associated with a specific lecture must be completed before that lecture.
Completed tutorials are sent to kanes.datacamp@gmail.com with your name and the name of the tutorial (like “Sarah Jones; Getting Started”) in the subject line.
Join the Discord server here: https://discord.gg/5wyvDv6HbU
Week 1: Visualization
Tuesday, June 1, 8:00 – 9:00 PM. Read Getting Started and follow all the associated instructions. We will do the Getting Started tutorial together in class.
Wednesday, June 2, 8:00 – 9:00 PM. Read Chapter 1 Visualization. Complete Visualization A and Visualization B tutorials.
Thursday, June 3, 8:00 – 9:00 PM. Read “Git, GitHub, and RStudio” from the Appendix on Tools and complete Visualization C and Git/Github tutorials.
Optional: Read and watch the videos from Getting Used to R, RStudio, and R Markdown by Chester Ismay and Patrick C. Kennedy
Week 2: Wrangling
Monday, June 7, 8:00 – 9:00 PM. Read Chapter 2 Wrangling Data and “Working with the terminal” from the Appendix on Tools. Complete Wrangling A and Terminal tutorials.
Wednesday, June 9, 8:00 – 9:00 PM. Read “How to Get Help” from the Appendix on Tools. Complete Wrangling B, C and D.
Thursday, June 10, 8:00 – 9:00 PM. Optional lecture and catch up session. Supervised by course teaching fellows.
Optional: RStudio Essentials Videos. Most relevant for us are “Writing code in RStudio”, “Projects in RStudio” and “Github and RStudio”. Again, these are optional! But they are very useful for students who find traditional lectures to be a helpful supplement to classroom practice.
Week 3: Data
Monday, June 14, 8:00 – 9:00 PM. Read Chapter 3 Data. Complete Data A tutorial.
Wednesday, June 16, 8:00 – 9:00 PM. Complete Data Webscraping and Data API tutorials.
Thursday, June 17, 8:00 – 9:00 PM. Optional lecture and catch up session. Supervised by course teaching fellows.
Optional: TBA
Week 4: Projects
The last week will consist of projects that the students will make. Do you love soccer or wine or NYC politics? The final project provides you with an opportunity to study that topic in depth. Your final project will be, for most of you, the first item in your professional portfolio, something so impressive that you will be eager to show it to graduate schools or potential employers. Further requirements and guidelines will be provided before the students begin their work.
Recommended readings: Distill for R Markdown is the main documentation page. Key sections are Creating a Website and Publishing Websites. Step-by-step guides include:
Building a blog with distill by Thomas Mock.
Building a {distill} website by Lisa Lendway.
Create a distill website and More on distill articles and deploy website by Ariel Muldoon.
Schedule
Monday, June 21, 8:00 – 9:00 PM. Introduction to distill.
Wednesday, June 23, 8:00 – 9:00 PM. Practice presentations and feedback.
Thursday, June 24, 8:00 – 9:00 PM. Final project presentations.

articles.title: Staff
articles.description: Meet the staff members of the 2021 Summer Data Science Bootcamp!
articles.contents:
David Kane



David Kane is the Preceptor in Statistical Methods and Mathematics in the Department of Government at Harvard University.
 
Dario Anaya



Dario Anaya is the Program Director for Kane’s Data Science Bootcamp and a rising senior at Andrean High School, near the Chicago. Please contact Dario (kanes.datacamp@gmail.com) with any questions about the program.
 
Becca Gill



Becca Gill is an (incoming) student in the Class of 2025 at Yale University.
 
Nosa Lawani



Nosa Lawani is a student in the Class of 2024 at Harvard University.
 
Nuo Wen Lei



Nuo Wen Lei is a student in the Class of 2022 at Concord Academy.
 
Heather Li



Heather Li is an incoming student in the Class of 2024 at the University of Oxford.
 
Ajay Malik



Ajay Malik is an incoming senior at William Fremd High School, graduating in 2022.
 
Stephanie Saab



Stephanie Saab is an incoming first-year student at the University of Toronto.
